TopicTitle: The Asteroid Sentinels: A KSP Graphic Novel (Series 8 Episode 10: Finale!)

Articles.Content:
THE ASTEROID SENTINELS

Due to the release of the Asteroid Day mod, I decided to write a graphic novel detailing my explorations of asteroids. It's notable that there is a huge bump in production quality and plot over time, which is why there are a couple ways to read The Asteroid Sentinels.

1. You can read the whole thing from Series 1. It's good if you want to know every bit in the story, but the current stories are quite different in format and plot from the first ones.

2. You can also read from Series 5 with this *Star Wars*-style title crawl that summarizes the Series 1-4. (Series 5's format is quite similar to the current ones)

**COMPANION THREADS**

**[Self-Analysis and More on the Series (Read it after you've read the series)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/158500-thoughts-and-ramblings-on-the-asteroid-sentinels-and-future-works/#comment-3009228)**

![AJAndPn.png](http://i.imgur.com/AJAndPn.png)

![BD8zPQF.png](http://i.imgur.com/BD8zPQF.png)

Gene Kerman: ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif) So what's the trajectory? Surely Elon's Falcon is too large for an <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> mission right? Why Infrared?

Wernher Von Kerman: ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)Nah, Heliocentric. We'll send it on a Eve flyby to cut the orbit, and because when we're inside Kerbin's Orbit, we will be able to investigate Asteroids IN Kerbin's orbit, something our telescopes on Kerbin can't do. We'll toss on the Infrared Scope because it can find faint objects we wouldn't see coming on our normal telescopes.

Gene: ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif) So once we find a asteroid heading for us, we will deflect it with a large rocket?

Wernher Von Kerman:![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Sure thing, I'm working on it. Hopefully we can capture it to study it too! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![ZWADYE2.png](http://i.imgur.com/ZWADYE2.png)

Wernher Von Kerman: Launch window is in 10 days, we'll have to be quick but safe about it.

End Of Entry 1.
